Authors: Wiannastiti M., Oktriono K., Simatupang M.S.
Title: Digital literacy of ELT lecturers in different contexts: A case at two universities in Jakarta
Affiliations: Language Center, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Humanities, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Universitas Kristen Indonesia, English Literature, Faculty of Letters, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wiannastiti, M., Language Center, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Humanities, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Language Center, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Humanities, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Simatupang, M.S., Universitas Kristen Indonesia, English Literature, Faculty of Letters, Indonesia
Abstract: ICT has been implemented for language teaching in higher education since its advent. In the process, the utilization of ICT in language teaching has not comprehensively embraced for the level of digital literacies and the different context of universities. This research aims to explore the level of digital literacies at the universities and distinct context of General English (GE) teaching in two private universities in Jakarta. In this frame, the research describes the category of ICT implemented and the relevant aspects of the lecturers in both universities to teach General English. In supporting this, a triangular method of data collection is applied in the research. Technically, a questionnaire consisting of closed and open questions was distributed to lecturers from both universities. The data is analyzed qualitatively based on percentages indicator. The result revealed that the respondents have a good level of digital literacy. However, they lacked some knowledge and skills in managing the classes in an online platform. As a result, the research contributes to providing training to support them in coping with the need for teaching GE with accepted digital literacy. © 2019 ACM.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Data collection; Digital; Digital literacies; Higher education; Jakarta; Lecturers; Literacy; Online platforms; Teaching
Funding Text 1: Thank you to the Bina Nusantara University for the supported grant.

Authors: Prabowo D., Wiannastiti M., Hedwig R.
Title: Simulation of Mitsubishi RV-M1 Robotic Arms by Using MATLAB® for High School Teaching
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prabowo, D., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wiannastiti, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Since most of high school students in Jakarta love robots very much, they join Engineering Club at school. Unfortunately, only few high schools have a real robot arm for students to learn in their school labs. The purpose of this research is to create a small simulation program based on MATLAB® and Robotic Toolbox 9.10 which resembles Mitsubishi RV-M1 robotics arm. The simulation is a 3D view and 5 degree of freedom which its end-effectors position is as close as the real one. It is hoped the results of this research study can be used as a base for further development of human controlled robotics arms simulation. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Degrees of freedom (mechanics); Risk management; Robotic arms; Robotics; Systems engineering; Degree of freedom; High school; High school students; High school teachings; Mitsubishi; Real robot; Research studies; Simulation program; MATLAB

Authors: Wiannastiti M., Sujarwo S., Oktriono K.
Title: Promoting literacy in an EFL online learning class through LMS discussion forum: A case study
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wiannastiti, M., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sujarwo, S., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The advance of invented technology has influenced the world of education including for higher education. It leases the higher education institutions offer online learning program with the specific way of teaching and learning. This paper is aimed to reveal some challenges faced by the students in an EFL online learning class, to promote literacy activities in the class and to promote how digital literacy supports EFL literacy in this online class. Responses from students of an online learning class in their Learning Management System (LMS) Discussion Forum are used to reveal their challenges in joining the class Some suggestion of activities to promote language literacy, especially English literacy are provided to give step by step learning. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: EFL; Literacy; LMS; Online Learning; Technology
Index Keywords: Students; Digital literacies; Discussion forum; Higher education; Higher education institutions; Learning management system; Literacy; Online learning; Teaching and learning; E-learning

Authors: Wiannastiti M., Sujarwo S., Matthew R.T., Oktriono K.
Title: Students’ writing test using an integrated-multimedia website: A case study of English professional class
Affiliations: English Department, Language Center Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Informatics Engineering, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tourism Destination, Language Center, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wiannastiti, M., English Department, Language Center Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sujarwo, S., Informatics Engineering, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Matthew, R.T., Informatics Engineering, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Tourism Destination, Language Center, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Since its inception, the demand for high technology in teaching learning is escalating. Presumably, a demand emerges in assessing students’ achievement by using technology. In language teaching learning, it is undeniable that the technology is also applied in assessing students’ language skills including writing. In assessing writing, in a common type, the process is carried out manually or typed in a word document. Based on the results, this research aims to explain the development of an integrated multimedia website for assessing writing and the potential of using the website for writing test. Questionnaires were distributed to 28 students joining English Professional Course at BINUS Online Learning to evaluate the promptness of the website for the test and the students’ sense of the website functionality. The result denoted that the website contribution is well-equipped to use as a tool and to test the writing skill. Moreover, the users were comfortable to exert it for undertaking the writing test. Equally important, the developments on the website require continuous improvement, especially for the variation of the questions including to add video and audio integration eventually. © 2018 ACM.
Author Keywords: ESL; Integrated-multimedia; Technology; Website; Writing test
Index Keywords: E-learning; Surveys; Teaching; Websites; Continuous improvements; High technology; Integrated-multimedia; Language teachings; Online learning; Teaching-learning; Word documents; Writing skills; Students

Authors: Wiannastiti M., Yulianto B., Wibisurya A.
Title: Bingar: A computer-assisted speaking exam using integrated multimedia
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: English Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wiannastiti, M., English Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yulianto, B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wibisurya, A., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Direct speaking exam by one to one interaction between an examiner and an examinee requires a lot of time and efforts. Therefore, a speaking exam needs to be automated. The purpose of this research is to develop a computer assisted (automated) speaking exam called Bingar. This application incorporates multimedia elements, i.e. texts, images, audios, and videos, is developed. Furthermore, it consists of two applications: the exam manager, which facilitates the creation of each exam item, and the exam player, which is used to play the exam items sequentially and record the examinee's answer. Evaluation result shows that the application is ready to use to conduct an automatic speaking exam. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Computer assisted; E assessments; Evaluation results; multimedia; Multimedia elements; Ready to use; speaking exam; Bins

Authors: Putri E.H., Fadilah D.R., Ivan, Suhartono D., Wiannastiti M.
Title: Thematic development for measuring cohesion and coherence between sentences in English paragraph
Source title: 2016 4th International Conference on Information and Communication Technology, ICoICT 2016
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; English Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, E.H., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fadilah, D.R., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ivan, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suhartono, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wiannastiti, M., English Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Writing is a skill of marking coherent words on a paper and composing a text. There are several criteria of good writing, two of them are cohesion and coherence. Research of cohesion and coherence writing has been conducted by using Centering Theory and Entity Transition Value method. However, the result can still be improved. Therefore, in this research, we tried to use Thematic Development approach which focused on the use of Theme and Rheme as a method to analyze coherence level of a paragraph, combined with CogNIAC rules and Centering Theory to analyze its cohesion. Besides improving the result of previous methods, this research aims to help users in evaluating and assessing their writing text. To achieve these objectives, the proposed method is compared to previous works as well as human judge. Based on the experiment, the proposed method yields average result of 91% which is nearly equivalent to human judge which is 92%. Thematic Development also yields better result compared to Centering Theory which is 29% and Entity Transition Value which is 0%, given the same data set of beginner and intermediate simple writing. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: coherence; cohesion; english paragraph; thematic development
Index Keywords: Coherent light; Centering theories; cohesion; Data set; Development approach; english paragraph; thematic development; Transition values; Adhesion
